summary:
With relevant experience of working as a university teacher, a research assistant and a helpline counselor, I aspire to seek opportunities in research and clinical settings. In the future, I strive to do therapy work, with special interest for personality and resilience.

Graduate of a Dutch research-oriented MSc of Clinical Psychology, holding a Croatian MSc degree in Psychology.

school.name: Faculty of Humanities and Social Sciences, University of Zagreb
XVI Gymnasium of Zagreb; bilingual programme (English language)

awards.title: Case Study Competition 2017 - 1st place
awards.description:
My colleague Lucija Drača and I teamed up to present a case study for Reebok Croatia. The task was to create a campaign which would help establish Reebok on the market as a running brand, specialized for runners in the 'tough fitness' category. We have been given first place.

Case Study Competition is the leading regional competition in solving actual business cases intended for students of all interests. The CSC provides the opportunity for students to present their knowledge, skills and abilities before one of the best Croatian enterprises and future employers.

awards.title: Case Study Competition 2016 - 2nd place
awards.description:
Case Study Competition is the leading regional competition in solving actual business intended for students of all interests. The CSC provides the opportunity for students to present their knowledge, skills and abilities before one of the best Croatian enterprises and future employers.

Along with my team members Lucija Drača, Borjan Pavlek and Sebastian Šušnjar, we have presented our case solution for Pliva & Teva group, creating an e-campaign for an upcoming type of birth control.
We have been elected as the first runner-up team.

profile_positions.description:
BSc Psychology in English, Clinical specialization
Theoretical courses; interviewing skills courses; theses supervision; course development.
profile_positions.title: Junior Lecturer/Teacher

profile_positions.description:
Assisting in setting up an experiment run on Qualtrics for an international project.
Tasks included creating a Qualtrics survey with simple custom programmed features, and linking it to an eye tracker.
profile_positions.title: Research Study Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Assisting on an EEG research project at the Erasmus Behavioral Lab (EBL) since September 2020.

Executing two types of tasks - administrative and practical.
Administrative tasks included contacting the participants, booking the lab sessions, preparing an analysis instruction document, and overall organization assistance. Practical tasks imply data collection in an the EEG lab. Research is done using the BioSemi ActiveTwo system (with 32+4 channels + 2 GSR electrodes).

My MA thesis at the EUR was part of this project (since September 2020). For these purposes I have been trained to use the EEG equipment and directed how to analyze the collected data in BrainVision Analyzer 2.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

company.name: World Festival of Animated Film - Animafest Zagreb

profile_positions.company: World Festival of Animated Film - Animafest Zagreb
profile_positions.title: Coordinator Of Volunteers

profile_positions.description:
As a backstage manager, I was in charge of the band and their crew, total of 24 people, and for a band crew of 9.
I took care of the catering, supplies beforehand, on the day of the concert and for their following tour travel.
The tasks included budgeting, time management, hospitality and fast problem-solving.
profile_positions.title: Backstage Manager

profile_positions.description:
A chaperone for an international commercial shoot as a part of the a production agency.
In summary, my task was to be the person available to the foreign clients. This included managing van pick ups, dinner reservations, necessities on set and insuring that all clients' needs are met in order for the shoot to run smooth.
I have performed this role for six to ten people for three days.
profile_positions.title: Hospitality - Chaperone

profile_positions.description:
- observing customer behavior and customer's response to retail settings
- tracking customer's movement in store space, recording their specific actions and recurring issues that the environment may have
- informal interviewing the employees to collect information on frequent errors, as for their opinion in space redesign
- analyzing and writing reports based on the collected data
profile_positions.title: Retail Researcher

profile_positions.description:
While doing a student internship, I am assigned a mentor who is a psychologist and an HR specialist.
Through few weeks, I have been introduced to the work of a recruitment agency. I have enjoyed the dynamic setting and got a glimpse of the various tasks such as writing job adverts, recruitment selection, psychological assessment (diverse personality and ability tests) and writing a psychological report, conducting a group testing and headhunting.

Some of the tests I have worked with: 16PF, EPQ, NEO-PI-R, PIE, D-48 (Domino test), D2 (for attention and concentration abilities), GAT (Cro. "TOS"), A-RPM and DAT.
profile_positions.title: HR Intern

profile_positions.description:
Spent my graduation year abroad, living in Utrecht as an au pair.
My main tasks and duties were similar to a childcare worker. I was looking after 3 children -  a boy (4 y/o) and twins (a boy and a girl; 2 y/o), concurrently helping them learn English as a second language.

Performance of the given tasks requires some features like time-management and overall organizational skills, beside the features and skills needed for childcare.
profile_positions.title: Au pair

volunteer_experiences.description:
- counseling and support - helpline (for children and parents), chat and e-mail
- communication skills
- further education in the field through numerous trainings and education
- interdisciplinary work
- mentoring new volunteers (February-March 2017)

Extensive basic training in  working with abused and neglected children and the basic techniques of counselling work through topics: Emotionally disturbing calls, Electronic counselling, Communication skills, Multidisciplinary approach in children protection, Divorce, Abuse and neglect.

Additional training on the topics: Adolescence, Adoption, Attachment – supporting parents in encouraging child’s emotional development, Behavioral disorders, Chat counselling, Child anxiety, Children in court, Counselling skills – confrontation, Counselling skills in terms of “content” and “process”, Counsellor’s identity on helplines, Electronic abuse and violence, Forensic interview, Group processes, Manipulation of children during divorce, Multidisciplinary approach and cooperation in child protection, Parenting styles, Self-harm, Sexual abuse of children, Suicide, Support for grieving children
and The role of the Centre for Social Welfare in Child Protection.

"Zagrlimo s(v)e" (Let's (All) Hug) is a program coordinated by Brave Phone. The main purpose of the program is developing children's psycho-social strength and skills by creating a positive self-image, learning about emotions and coping, assertive communication skills and non-violent methods as well as children's rights.
Along with 2 great co-leaders, the program was realized through two workshop cycles throughout a school year, once every week.
The participants of the group were 6 wonderful children (11-14 y.o. in the first cycle; 8-12 y.o. in the second ) in Laduč group home.

volunteer_experiences.role: Psychological First Aid at the ''Baby&Mother's corner''
volunteer_experiences.description:
UNICEF and Društvo Naša Djeca Vinkovci
Ultimately, providing psycho-social care to the refugees at the Opatovac camp in eastern Croatia.
Positioned at the Baby&Mother's corner, the job included psychological first-aid, changing babies, preparing the milk formula and feeding the babies, changing the children clothes with the clean donated ones, creating a safe place for children to play and playing with them.
One of the biggest challenges was communicating with the refugees in a completely different way - the majority of them did not speak English or any other language besides Arabic. But we managed to solve every barrier in the way.

Diverse activities including setting up photo exhibitions and working in hospitality, along with guarding the exhibitions and preparing materials.
Also, working on the counter, welcoming guests and selling promotional materials, and at the bar, preparing food and drinks for the opening.
The festival took place in 2014 and 2015.
Volunteering for the South Easy European Child Protection Hub, translating articles in English to Croatian, and vice versa.
Gallery attendant at a multimedia exhibition ''In the rhythm of touch'' created primarily for persons with visual impairment including interaction with the visual-tactile exhibits.

volunteer_experiences.role: Promotion team leader (PR, social networking and community management)
volunteer_experiences.description:
- managing social networks (Facebook and Instagram)
 *number of likes January 10th 2016= 645; number of likes May 10th 2016= 1177 (182%)
- communication with a team of designers
- media advertisment

Promoting Facebook and Instagram pages for STUP (Psychology Students' Club) and Psihozij (Congress of Psychology Students), recreating the congress' brand and raising awareness to attract as many visitors.
The tasks include maintaining the pages' popularity with posts, creating events and communicating over e-mail and inbox messages. Also, cooperation with the designers and creating promotional materials (booklet content and program-timelines) on my own.

company.name: Dani Ramira i Zorana Bujasa // Ramiro and Zoran Bujas' Days

volunteer_experiences.description:
'​'Ramiro and Zoran Bujas'​ Days is an international biennial psychological conference which provides a forum for presenting knowledge and findings of fundamental and applied research from all fields of psychology.''
Having the opportunity to be a volunteer of RZBD, I had worked at multiple positions: at the 
registration desk, tech support in lecture halls, preparing materials for the participants and coffee breaks. The experience has offered me to partake in an event full of experts who helped me broaden my perspective in the field of psychology.

ZagrebDox is an international documentary film festival taking place in Zagreb. The festival is intended to provide audiences and experts insight into the recent documentary films, stimulate national documentary production and boost international and regional cooperation in co-productions.

As a volunteer, my job was to help prepare the festival centre before the festival week; working at the acreditation office, the tasks included making and give out acreditation, as well as impart relevant information; info-point desk is a special sector intended to orientate visitors and communicate feedback between the visitors and the organisation.

company.name: KinoKino - international film festival for children

volunteer_experiences.description:
KinoKino film festival for children had its first and promising edition, 16.-20. of March 2016 in Europa cinema.
As a volunteer, my tasks were preparing the auditorium of the movie theatre before and after movies and workshops for children, providing information for the visitors, handing out flyers and animating the children/visitors.
A sweet experience!

volunteer_experiences.role: representative of the helpline Hrabri telefon
volunteer_experiences.description: Representing the helpline's work to parents and children at the event Čarobni dan at Zagreb's park Maksimir. The tasks included puting forward the issues the helpline is faced with every day and encouraging both parents and children to dial whenever they feel the need to resolve their similar problems as it is not charged. Representing the helpline to children was through series of games and animating.

company.name: Trčanjem mijenjamo dijabetes // Running for Diabetes

volunteer_experiences.description: Preparing materials for the participants and providing information on the spot.
